page.title: 13STIBBINGTON'S NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The nature reserve is situated to the north of Stibbington Field Study Centre and lies between the river Nene and the A1. The reserve has developed around pits which were used for the extraction of gravel until forty years ago. The present owner is keen to promote wildlife conservation and to this end has allowed the area to regenerate naturally, though a small number of trees has been planted. Consequently the area now contains forty years growth of vegetation and also includes lakes which are well stocked with fish, various mammals and birds. The number of water birds has recently suffered a decline due to attacks by mink. The area is used for a variety of study purposes by residents of the Stibbington Field Study Centre.
